page.title: 13The landscape in Shotley
page.content: The main village of Shotley is about a mile from Shotley Gate,part of which is in our block. There are some older houses along the main road but most of the houses are modern ones on the estate built for service families. The land slopes down to the River Orwell to the east and the River Stour, just outside our block, to the south. There are marshes beside the Orwell, but, unlike those in Trimley, they have not been ploughed up and they are used for grazing by cattle or are cut for silage.In the winter the wet land attracts wading birds and some ducks, Except at Shotley Point ,there is little mud exposed here at low tide, but there is an interesting area of saltmarsh near Crane's Hill. The higher land is used for arable farming,mostly grain.
